intro: Diplazium tenuicaule, commonly known as slender-stemmed water fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are divided into four lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant typically grows in slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and streams. Its reproductive structures include small, inconspicuous flowers that develop into tiny, bladder-like fruits. Diplazium tenuicaule plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
